p_c96be22e7e0158ea: Job Description We see an urgent demand for consultants in our Cognitive & Analytics practice since an increasing number of our customers are going through a Cognitive Transformation. We are looking for driven and experienced new colleagues to embrace this opportunity together with us.  You will be working closely with our clients by Agile and Design Thinking Methodologies, innovating and improving industries with AI Technology. Together with your project teams you will deliver everything from state-of-the-art solutions to quicker value proving solutions.  You’ll also have a platform for growing in many different areas, from being a part of a Nordic Data Science community, and also learning more about AI technologies with the help of IBM courses and material, to growing as a Consultant by working with proven IBM Methodologies and very likely working with international clients.  Depending on your area of expertise within Data Science; i.e. business analytics and/or deep technical skills within areas such as AI or machine learning – you’ll be part of our European Analytics and Data Management practice. You’ll take responsibility for providing technical subject matter expertise around advanced and large-scale data analysis.  You will likely have a Master degree in a relevant quantitative field such as statistics, operations research or computer science. In addition, you’ll have significant industry experience as consultant, analyst or research scientist and you’ll be used to working with client business functions on various levels.  In this job you will need to have in-depth knowledge of relevant advanced analytics methods such as mathematics, machine learning, statistics, data mining and/or operations research as well as experience of data analysis and different aspects of data quality management. You’ll also have a good understanding of business challenges in the industries you’ve worked in and be able to explain analytical insights to a non-technical audience.  To hear our own consultants describing what it is like to work as a consultant at IBM, please watch this video: https://youtu.be/rFEsQJJD8-I  Your key skills will include: Strong quantitative and analytical expertise that covers statistics, machine learning/ deep learning/ data mining, experimentation methodology Multiple years of advanced hands-on experience in leading advanced analytics tools such as Python (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Keras etc) , R, SPSS, SAS or MATLAB Multiple years of hands-on experience in conducting analyses on structured / semi-structured as well as unstructured data (e.g. ETL Analysis, Data Profiling, Data Quality Analysis, Data Quality Assessment, Source Data Analysis, Source to Target mapping) Experience with emerging large-scale Big Data analytics tools (such as the Apache Hadoop Ecosystem, Apache Spark/MLlib, Apache Mahout and the like) will be a strong advantage Experience in advanced analytics use cases in one or more dedicated industries Strong communication skills and business acumen, including a feeling for data visualization and experience in presenting complex information to business stakeholders in a compelling way  IBM is market leader in the Data & Analytics space. We offer a dynamic, innovative and international environment which is fuelled by projects with leading clients, unique capabilities such as IBM Research & Development and IBM Watson, and a growing ecosystem of partnerships such as those with Apple and Twitter. If you think you have the skill and the attitude to change the way that business is conducted – IBM is the place for you and will offer you numerous opportunities for growth across the company.  In your application we expect you to explain your experience/ if any, in the following fields; Applied machine learning and statistical analysis, Deep Learning, Optimization and operation research, Data cleaning and pre-processing analysis.  Work location: Stockholm or Gothenburg   Required Technical and Professional Expertise  At least 3 years experience in applying Machine Learning / Statistics / Data Mining At least 3 years experience in conducting analytics on structured and unstructured data At least 3 years experience in data analysis and data quality management At least 3 years experience in Python, R, SPSS, SAS or MATLAB At least 3 years experience in Relational Databases / SQL At least 2 years experience in data processing using Python, Scala or Java English: Fluent  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Master's Degree in Information Technology Swedish: Fluent  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

This way you ensure that we deliver the best possible financial product wherever Northmill is present. Who are you? p_eda2d828093b9c74: You will focus on conceptualizing customer data stories into relevant actionable insights and communicate across the HBO Europe business. p_24b59718970b709f: Are you someone who likes to help make the world a better place, and not content going to work designing yet another service that people don't really need? Our journey Diet Doctor was founded in 2007 by Andreas Eenfeldt, MD, who was inspired to help people eat better and live a healthier life. Beginning as a simple blog, we are now in 2019 the global leader in our niche, with more than 30 full time co-workers around the world. Most of us work from our central Stockholm office. What you may be surprised to know is that Diet Doctor is fully self-funded, and we have never taken VC money – pretty unique for a fast-growing startup that is more than doubling in size every year. This makes us fully in control of our own destiny, and not beholden to outside influence. Apart from competitive salaries and benefits, this allows us to offer all employees to buy a stake in the company regularly. The Engineering team that you will join is small but growing steadily. We are taking our time to find the right people, and since we're still less than 10 people it also implies that you will be given a lot of responsibility – and have an equally strong voice in both what we do and how we do it. What’s in it for you? The chance to start a new chapter in Diet Doctor history, where we begin focusing deeply on Big Data, analytics, and machine learning. This includes helping out building the new Data group with more amazing people. The opportunity to get into the company early on, helping us evolve our products and services ecosystem at a moment when the company is growing very fast (> 150% year over year) but still is small enough for you to make a deep personal impact. Shape your own role as we grow together and our needs evolve. Own a meaningful part of the company that you put your best work into, through our direct shares offering to employees that occur on a regular basis. Many interesting problems to solve, and future products & services to be designed and built – all on a global scale and with meaningful impact on people’s lives. Our reach The largest low-carb site in the world. 500k daily visits, more than doubling our traffic year over year. Top Google ranking for our segment. Global presence (English, Spanish, Swedish and more coming). iOS app (released in January 2019); Android app coming soon. Our tech stack Modern frontend with new development being based primarily on React. Lots of juicy behavioural data being collected every day (GDPR-friendly of course). CMS based on WordPress (PHP/MySQL). Microservices built mainly in Go & run on Kubernetes/Docker. GraphQL API for external clients (including our iOS app). Deployed on Amazon’s AWS cloud. Who you are You have a long experience and knowledge in Big Data, statistics, analytics and machine learning, and is passionate about finding useful and meaningful patterns in big data sets that could help improve our users' lives. You have a grasp on managing projects, and inspire your team members to get things done – on deadline and with the level of production quality required for the reliability and global scalability we need. You think holistically, being able to move from the big picture visionary level down to the details, both when designing and while implementing. You have a passion for creating beautiful code, with a focus on readability and maintainability. You have a lot of experience working as part of a fast-moving team, delivering quality code on time. You are a self-going and pragmatic doer who enjoys taking responsibility. Finally, you are someone who wants to contribute to truly make the world a better place. What you’ll do You will be part of the new Data group in the Engineering team, and help set the agenda for how we should apply data thinking to our company roadmap. You will build and deploy modern, maintainable, robust, and scalable machine learning models that we can deploy at global scale. You will help analyse our analytics and metrics data and help build dashboards, visualisations, and reports to spread the information to all teams at Diet Doctor, to improve our collective knowledge base of the current state of the company and our users. You will support our primary mission – delivering valuable content and services to our members to help them improve their health. Technical qualities Deep knowledge and experience deploying Big Data machine learning models to the cloud. Comfortable using statistical languages and tooling like Python, Swift, R, Tensorflow, etc. 5+ years of experience in this field. Experience with applying data, machine learning models, and analytics to product development is a big plus. Previous contribution to open source software projects and the community is highly valued. The position We strive to build our Engineering team with dedicated full-time employees, so we are currently not looking for freelancers or consultants. You will be working primarily from our beautiful and airy Swedish HQ here in Stockholm (Vasagatan 40, just opposite the central station). Do you currently live somewhere else but speak excellent English? For exceptional candidates we will help with your move here, and also finding a place to live. Timing not perfect? Reach out anyway – we’ll wait for the right person. Apply now Applications will be processed as soon as we receive them. Please include the following to make the interview process as fast and smooth as possible: Short personal letter about why you’re right for this job, and why you would like to work at Diet Doctor (please keep it at a single page). Links to projects you have been involved with (please describe your individual involvement). Salary range suggestion. Bonus: Relevant code samples that we can discuss during the first interviews (not mandatory but will definitely move you ahead in the queue). We look forward to your application!
p_87f47b0e667d78bf: At Epidemic Sound we are reinventing the music industry. Our carefully curated music library, with over 30,000 tracks, is tailored for storytellers no matter what their story is. Countless customers around the world, from broadcasters, productions companies and YouTubers rely on our tracks to help them tell their stories. Epidemic Sound’s music is heard in hundreds of thousands of videos on online video platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitch and Instagram. Our HQ is located in Stockholm with offices in NYC, LA, Hamburg, Amsterdam and Madrid. We are growing fast, we have lots of fun and we are transforming the music industry. The growth of our business requires us to be excellent at building and maintaining relationships with our customers to inspire action and loyalty. To achieve this, we need to make our user experience next level, through intuitive machine learning and customer analytics. We are now looking for an experienced Machine Learning Specialist (you’re likely currently a Data Scientist, or perhaps an advanced Insight Analyst who’s had the opportunity to use Machine Learning in a commercial environment).  Job description The position as a Machine Learning Specialist will report directly in to the CTO, in a fresh new team which functions as a de-centralised squad, delivering advanced analysis and machine learning to various departments throughout the company. You’ll work alongside Data Engineers and Developers to deploy microservices solving many different business needs. The use cases range from Customer Lifetime Value & Churn prediction – to building fantastic recommender engines to further personalize Epidemic Sound’s offering. You will be working closely with the backend data team in developing robust, scalable algorithms. You will improve the personalization of the product by: Analysing behaviours of visitors, identifying patterns and outliers which can indicate their likelihood to Churn. Developing classification systems through feature extraction on music to identify type & ‘feel’ of any given content. Creating recommender engines so that the music our users see first, is relevant to them based on their behaviours. Contributing to the automation of previously manual tasks, by leveraging the classification systems you’ve contributed to building. Consulting on appropriate implementation of algorithms in practice – and actively identifying new use cases that can help improve Epidemic Sound!  What are we looking for? We’re looking for a team member with a “no task is too small” mindset – we are at the beginning of our Machine Learning journey – so we need someone who thinks building something from scratch sounds exciting. It would be music to our ears if you have: Deep understanding of machine learning (neural networks, deep learning, classification, regression) Experience with machine learning in production Experience with: tensorflow, keras, pytorch, sciki-learn, scipy, numpy, pandas or similar Experience with ml projects in customer value or music information retrieval (MIR) Fluency in python programming and a passion for production ready code Experience from Google Cloud and/or AWS MSc in a Quantitative or Computer Science based subject (Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics) Curious about our music? Find our music on Spotify here https://open.spotify.com/user/epidemicsound  Application Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply by clicking the link below.

p_42f09e2315d3daa9: Institutionen för medicin, Solna, är en av de största kliniska institutionerna vid Karolinska Institutet. Institutionen är uppdelad i avdelningar som i sin tur består av en eller flera forskargrupper. Verksamheten består av forskning, forskarutbildning och grundutbildning för blivande läkare och biomedicinare. Institutionen har tre profilområden: allergi, kardiovaskulär medicin och inflammatoriska sjukdomar. A doctoral student is admitted to third-cycle/doctoral education. A doctoral education consists of supervised research, combined with courses and other educational activities. An individual study plan is established for each doctoral student. For a doctoral degree, the equivalent of four years of full-time doctoral education is required. Research group The project will be performed in close collaboration between the team of Ewa Ehrenborg (professor) in the Cardiovascular theme at BioClinicum, Karolinska University Hospital (Solna); Paolo Parini (professor) and Paolo Garagnani (associate professor) at the Lipo-Group Research Constellation, Karolinska University Hospital (Huddinge). Together, this will bring together a wide range of competences – encompassing advanced molecular and cell biology, cardio metabolic genetics, transcriptional ad epigenetic regulation, functional analysis of genetic variants and cardiovascular biology – for the student to learn from. The project will mainly be pursued at BioClinicum, Karolinska University Hospital, Solna but also at Karolinska University Hospital, Huddinge and at the University of Bologna. The doctoral student project and the duties of the doctoral student The overall aim of this doctoral project is to delineate how the insulin sensitizer metformin influence different autophagy pathways involved in longevity and diseases of ageing such as cardiovascular diseases. The translational approach of this project includes both mechanistic and descriptive studies based on results from unique biobanks. Indeed, the project involves a wide variety of state-of-the-art techniques from cell/tissue culture, cell and molecular biology, confocal imaging to statistical analysis of complex biological data. The student will under supervision plan and perform experiments, analyse data, interpret and present the results and write scientific papers. The doctoral student will work independently formulating new hypotheses and critically evaluate results, but also interact closely with other researchers, PhD students and clinicians in cardiovascular medicine and other disciplines. The applicant is expected to be a talented and enthusiastic aspiring researcher with strong drive to perform translational research. He or she is expected to develop into an independent scientist whom can play a leading role in the elaboration of scientific hypothesis, experimental design, experimentation, data analysis and presentation/publication of the research. Eligibility requirements for doctoral education In order to participate in the selection for a doctoral position, you must meet the following general (A) and specific (B) eligibility requirements at latest by the application deadline. It is your responsibility to certify eligibility by following the instructions on the web page Entry requirements (eligibility) for doctoral education. A) General eligibility requirement You meet the general eligibility requirement for doctoral/third-cycle/PhD education if you: have been awarded a second-cycle/advanced/master qualification (i.e. master degree) or have satisfied the requirements for courses comprising at least 240 credits of which at least 60 credits were awarded in the advanced/second-cycle/master level, or have acquired substantially equivalent knowledge in some other way in Sweden or abroad.* Follow the instructions on the web page Entry requirements (eligibility) for doctoral education.If you claim equivalent knowledge, follow the instructions on the web page Assessing equivalent knowledge for general eligibility for doctoral education. B) Specific eligibility requirement You meet the specific eligibility requirement for doctoral/third-cycle/PhD education if you: Show proficiency in English equivalent to the course English B/English 6 at Swedish upper secondary school. Follow the instructions on the web page English language requirements for doctoral education. Verification of your documents Karolinska Institutet checks the authenticity of your documents. Karolinska Institutet reserves the right to revoke admission if supporting documents are discovered to be fraudulent. Submission of false documents is a violation of Swedish law and is considered grounds for legal action. Skills and personal qualities We are looking for a highly motivated person with innovative thinking and some knowledge in the research field of cardiovascular disease, aging, metabolism and/or autophagy. The applicant should have a solid background in biochemistry, molecular and cell biology. Also, knowledge of basic statistics and laboratory experience in cell culture, immunological and molecular biology techniques is an advantage. Good communication skills and fluency in the English language, written and spoken are required. Applications are welcomed from ambitious and committed students with a good ability to work efficiently as part of a team. Terms and conditions The doctoral student will be employed on a doctoral studentship maximum 4 years full-time. Application process Submit your application and supporting documents through the Varbi recruitment system. Use the button in the top right corner and follow the instructions. Your application should contain the following documents: A personal letter and a curriculum vitae (Swedish or English) Degree projects and previous publications, if any (Swedish or English) Any other documentation showing the desirable skills and personal qualities described above (Swedish or English) Documents certifying your general eligibility (see A above) Documents certifying your specific eligibility (see B above) Selection A selection will be made among eligible applicants on the basis of the ability to benefit from doctoral education. The qualifications of the applicants will be evaluated on an overall basis. KI uses the following bases of assessment: Documented subject knowledge of relevance to the area of research Analytical skill Other documented knowledge or experience that may be relevant to doctoral studies in the subject.  All applicants will be informed when the recruitment is completed. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet med visionen att på ett avgörande sätt bidra till att förbättra människors hälsa. I Sverige står Karolinska Institutet för den enskilt största andelen medicinsk akademisk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar. Varje år utser Nobelförsamlingen vid Karolinska Institutet mottagare av Nobelpriset i fysiologi eller medicin.  Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter arkiveras ansökningshandlingar i två år efter att tillsättningsbeslutet vunnit laga kraft. Detta gäller dock ej bilagor som är tryckta eller på annat sätt publicerade.  Karolinska Institutet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats med jämn könsfördelning som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.  Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
pj_a14b5ea191807a3b: Brinner du för utveckla affärer och verksamheter genom insikt och analys? Då är jobbet som analyschef på Aller media något för dig Vill du vara med och bygga upp en modern analysavdelning på ett av nordens största mediehus och vidareutveckla varumärken som Elle, Baaam och Feminina? VI ERBJUDER DIG Här erbjuds du möjligheten att driva företagets digitala resa framåt och sätta analys på kartan. Aller media är en datadriven organisation som kan erbjuda dig utrymmet att bygga något nytt från grunden. Här kommer du in i en familjär och välkomnande atmosfär där vi värdesätter samarbete framför vassa armbågar. Varje dag skapar Aller media innehåll och tjänster för att göra Sveriges kvinnors liv rikare. DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS Din primära uppgift blir att öka analyskraften i alla delar av affären. För att kunna skapa 360-analyser, personaliserade erbjudanden och innehåll behövs en datalake byggas och en ny organisation formas. Därför söker vi dig som vill växa och utveckla snarare än förvalta. Du kommer bland annat: Ansvara för rekrytering och prioritera actions framåt Leda och driva arbetet mot en datalake, som i sin tur kommer ligga till grund för framtida analysarbete Skapa 360-analyser för att få en bättre förståelse och bli ännu mer relevanta för Aller medias målgrupp Vara med och sätta upp KPI:er och modeller för konvertering. DITT TEAM OCH ARBETSPLATS Aller media arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och i det kommer du ha en central roll som innebär daglig kontakt med övriga delar av organisationen. I rollen kommer du även att samarbeta med Aller medias nordiska enheter. Kontoret är beläget vid Stureplan i centrala Stockholm. Teamet består idag av data scientist, webanalytiker, kundinsiktsanalytiker och förväntas växa under din ledning MER OM DIG Vi föreställer oss att du tidigare haft en operativ roll inom analys och nu gått mot en mer strategisk riktning. Du har en förmåga att få med dig människor och kan med lätthet förmedla värdet av analysarbetet i relation till strategiska beslut. Vidare ser vi framför oss att du tilltalas av att driva den digitala resan utifrån ett holistiskt perspektiv. Du tänker brett och har förmågan att ta nya perspektiv och är inte rädd för att kliva in och ta initiativ, samtidigt som förändringen man ska genomföra kräver ödmjukhet och lyhördhet. Vi hoppas och tror att du brinner för Aller medias produkter och ser tydligt framför dig hur du kan bidra till organisationens fortsatta växande. SÅ HÄR FÅR VI KONTAKT I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!
p_1d8ebcef12860c31: Our client’s Advanced Analytics & AI department is looking for a passionate Data Scientist. As a key player in the team you will part of Data Product team. p_fdcd258fcc49cd1e: Vid Institutionen för neurobiologi, vårdvetenskap och samhälle (NVS) bedrivs världsledande forskning inom åldrande, demens, epidemiologi och vårdvetenskap. Forskningen sträcker sig från grundforskning på molekyl- och cellnivå till kliniska studier och forskning på samhällsnivå. Vid NVS genomför cirka en tredjedel av KI:s studenter sin utbildning på grund- och avancerad nivå. Institutionen med cirka 450 anställda och en omsättning på 490 miljoner år 2018, består av sju sektioner och finns på Campus Flemingsberg och Campus Solna. Division The division of Clinical Geriatrics conducts education and multifaceted research in close collaboration with leading institutions and clinics worldwide. The division works in close collaboration with the KI Aging Research Center, and both divisions are part of the KI Center for Alzheimer Research, which conducts translational research on neurodegenerative diseases, especially those underlying cognitive impairment and dementia. The division of Clinical Geriatric is now posting a six year full time position as Assistant professor with specialization in geriatric epidemiology and clinical geriatrics. Research group Prof. Kivipelto is leading the multidisciplinary research team known as ‘Nordic Brain Network’ (NBN) collaborating with the University of Eastern Finland, National Institut of Health and Welfare in Helsinki, Finland and others. The NBN team is involved in several large international projects, EU projects and the Word-Wide FINGERS (www.wwfingers.com). The NBN team is also carrying out prevention trials testing multidomain interventions to prevent AD, as well as phase I-III drug trials for AD, at the Clinical Trials Unit, Karolinska University Hospital. We are looking for an Associate professor for a 4-year fulltime employment. Duties  The Associate professor will work to develop effective and sustainable multimodal preventative interventions for cognitive decline and AD, targeting people with different risk profiles. Main duties involve the development of strategies for primary, secondary and tertiary prevention of age-related cognitive decline, dementia and AD. This implies working with large databases from population-based and clinical-based projects, and with data gathered from observational and intervention studies. Additionally, the candidate is expected to conduct research aiming to gain better understanding of novel lifestyle risk factors for cognitive decline and dementia. The role involves working with a rich array of data, including neuropsychological, clinical, and medical data, such as a wide array of biomarkers (blood-based and salivary biomarkers and neuroimaging data. The post-holder will be involved in the design and conduction of non-pharmacological RCTs in older adults, conducted at the Clinical Trials Unit, Memory Clinic. Finally, the post holder should be willing to supervise Master and PhD students, and provide support for early career researchers. Eligibility requirements Those eligible for employment as an Assistant Professor are individuals who have been awarded a PhD or attained equivalent research competence. Preference should be given to those who were awarded a PhD or attained equivalent research competence no more than five years prior to the expiry of the application period for the position of assistant professor. Those who have been awarded a PhD or attained equivalent research competence earlier may however be considered if special grounds exist. Special grounds refer to illness or parental leave. We are seeking a scientist with a background in epidemiology or human neuroscience, with experience and expertise in geriatric epidemiological studies and in the field of dementia/AD biological markers, as well as documented experience of dealing with large databases. Excellent speaking and writing skills in English are mandatory. Functional communication skills in Swedish are required. Applicants with previous experience with EU projects and international projects will be given a higher rank. The candidate is expected to be independent in the areas of experimental design, data gathering and analysis as well as manuscript and grant preparation. Skills and personal qualities The applicant will be part of a dynamic international research team, composed of members with different backgrounds, educationally as well as culturally. The candidate should be driven and motivated, able to think open-minded, have a high level of responsibility, good communication skills, and the ability to work independently at a multidisciplinary level, as well as show team-working abilities and interpersonal skills. Bases of assessment We stress scientific expertise when assessing applicants. Application process An application must contain the following documents in Swedish/ English: curriculum vitae, qualifications and description of planned research, presented in accordance with Karolinska Institutet’s qualifications portfolio (http://ki.se/qualificationsportfolio). The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system. The applications will be reviewed by an external reviewer. Promotion of Assistant Professor to Senior Lecturer See the instructions regarding the Appointment Procedure for Teachers at Karolinska Institutet chapter 3.3 An Assistant Professor can apply for promotion to Senior Lecturer. An application is submitted to the Recruitment Committee. In order to be promoted to Senior Lecturer after an assessment by the Recruitment Committee, the applicant must meet the criteria below. The Assistant Professor can choose between two different promotion tracks; promotion to Senior Lecturer with focus on Research or promotion to Senior Lecturer with focus on Education and research. Promotion of Assistant Professor to Senior Lecturer with focus on Research  Assessment criteria Senior Lecturer expertise according to the eligibility requirements and assessment criteria for “Senior lecturer with focus on research”. Grants obtained as principal applicant in national or international competition that covers the applicant’s own salary for at least two years from the final date of employment as an Assistant Professor. Project funding obtained in national or international competition (i.e. excellence grants obtained from the Swedish Research Council, European Research Council (ERC), Wallenberg Foundation (WAF) or Swedish Foundation for Strategic Research (SSF) that covers costs for salaries, rent, materials and other project-related expenses for the research for at least two years from the final date of employment as an Assistant Professor. First and/or senior author of a number of peer-reviewed scientific articles published in leading international scientific journals over a number of years after dissertation, with the emphasis on the qualification period as an Assistant Professor. An independent research line deemed by independent experts and departmental management to offer excellent future potential for both the individual researcher and the department in question. A documented good ability to lead the own research group – including staff responsibility and supervision of doctoral and/or postdoctoral students. Scientific expertise is emphasized when assessing applicants including successful scientific results in a good working climate, as well as documented collaborative abilities. All experience of undertaking assignments on behalf of the scientific community – such as board membership, internal assessment committees, departmental duties, organising courses and conferences and editorships – will be considered as merits. Promotion of Assistant Professor to Senior Lecturer with focus on Education and research Assessment criteria Senior Lecturer expertise according to the eligibility requirements and assessment criteria for “Senior Lecturer with focus on Education and research”. Higher education training of 10 weeks or equivalent competence in accordance with the Association of Swedish Higher Education Institutions (SUHF). Independent responsibility for planning, implementation and evaluation of teaching and examination at all levels, first (basic undergraduate), second (advanced undergraduate) and third (graduate) -cycle study programmes and courses – to a significant extent and over a period of at least three years with documented high level of quality. Pedagogical management assignments as course director at first (basic undergraduate), second (advanced undergraduate) and third (graduate) cycle level. Extensive pedagogical experience of various forms of teaching and for various groups at first (basic undergraduate), second (advanced undergraduate) and third (graduate) cycle levels. Completed, nationally and internationally presented pedagogical development work resulting in improved study programmes and/or courses. A clear plan for the own pedagogical activities (including pedagogical development work) that demonstrates a high level of quality and great potential. If the applicant is deemed to fulfil all of the above criteria, they will be assessed by two experts in their field and must meet the eligibility requirements that apply to appointments as a Senior Lecturer at Karolinska Institutet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet med visionen att på ett avgörande sätt bidra till att förbättra människors hälsa. I Sverige står Karolinska Institutet för den enskilt största andelen medicinsk akademisk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar. Varje år utser Nobelförsamlingen vid Karolinska Institutet mottagare av Nobelpriset i fysiologi eller medicin.  Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter arkiveras ansökningshandlingar i två år efter att tillsättningsbeslutet vunnit laga kraft. Detta gäller dock ej bilagor som är tryckta eller på annat sätt publicerade.  Karolinska Institutet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats med jämn könsfördelning som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.  Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.

p_65036d95446dd527: UPSYS växer inom Maskininlärning och Green Tech. Kom och bygg en hållbar värld tillsammans med oss! DIN ROLL SOM UPSYSARE  Som UPSYS-konsult kommer du att ingå i ett team av skickliga systemutvecklare och arbeta utifrån vår agila projektmodell för att säkra kundvärde, ett effektivt flöde i leveransen och en hög kvalitet på produkten. Självklart nära den ort där du bor, balans i livet är viktigt tycker vi.  VI SÖKER DIG   Som brinner för att skapa verkligt värde för dina kunder och vill förstå kundens ambitioner och mål Som är skicklig på att driva projekt i mål Som gärna delar med dig av dina idéer för att det ska bli så bra som möjligt för alla i gruppen Som gillar att jobba i team och att skapa saker tillsammans med andra Som precis som vi, har ett nyfiken sätt att se på världen.. Som vill vara del av ett livskraftigt tech-företag i utveckling!  DIN ERFARENHET  Flera av följande saker stämmer in på dig:  Du har en akademisk utbildning i botten, förmodligen som civilingenjör eller datavetare Du har bra grundkoll på matematik och statistik Du behärskar minst ett programmeringsspråk på expertnivå och har förmåga att lära dig nya programmeringsspråk snabbt Du kan SQL och relationsdatabaser Du har erfarenhet av bildanalys eller ljudanalys Du är van vid att hämta, bearbeta och extrahera affärsvärde ur data Du känner till best-practices av de programmeringsverktyg du använder och är van vid att kommentera din kod Du lägger stort fokus på kvalitet vid systemutveckling och är van vid att testa dina lösningar med automatiska tester Du brinner för teknik och bedriver gärna egna hobbyprojekt  Krav:  Djupa kunskaper i minst ett programmeringsspråk Grundläggande kunskaper i SQL Vi ser det som mycket meriterande om du har erfarenhet av minst ett projekt inom maskininlärning  Meriterande:  Erfarenhet av någon del i Hadoops ekosystem t.ex. HDFS, MapReduce, Kafka, Sqoop, Pig, Hive, HBase, Storm eller Spark Design/utveckling av transaktionsintensiva system som hanterar stora datamängder AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud NoSQL, t.ex. Cassandra eller MongoDB BI-verktyg, t.ex. Tableau, Qlik eller PowerBI  VAD FÅR DU AV OSS   Intressanta uppdrag som ligger i framkant inom ny teknik och gör skillnad på riktigt Möjlighet att själv påverka din roll och dina uppdrag över tid. Vi är i förändring och allt är möjligt när vi sätter strategiska kundplaner framåt Möjlighet att jobba med problemlösning och produktutveckling, parallellt med ditt konsultuppdrag En god teamanda med erfarna och engagerade kollegor. Vi labbar, kör gemensamma frukostar, hackatons, Meetups, företagsmöten och företagskonferenser i och utanför Sveriges gränser En jordnära och driven kultur som bygger på lika delar hjärna, hjärta och business (IQ, EQ, BQ)  OM UPSYS   Affärsidé: UPSYS är ett högteknologiskt IT-företag med fokus på robusta, skalbara, säkra IT-lösningar inom Machine Learning, IoT och Data Science samt närliggande områden så som Cloud och säkerhet. Efter snart 30 år på marknaden är vi även mycket skickliga på beprövad teknik och generell systemutveckling. Mission: Vi brinner för att bidra till en hållbar värld och en konkurrenskraftig affär genom våra IT-lösningar och seniora kompetens. Vi gillar när våra lösningar gör skillnad på riktigt. Värdegrund: Vi tror på balansen mellan hjärna, hjärta och business, vilket också leder oss i allt vi gör. Vi är måna om att bygga en kultur där vi tar hand om varandra och ser till att alla mår bra idag och imorgon! Kontor: Vi är ett tight gäng på 25 seniora systemutvecklare och Data Scientist i Uppsala och Sthlm. Våra kontor är centralt belägna vid Centralstationerna i båda städerna (Kungsgatan i Uppsala och Waterfront i Sthlm) så att vi enkelt kan åka emellan när vi vill ses. Vi arbetar dock i den ort vi bor närmast för att få en bra balans i livet.
p_fd8072462dd20803: Brinner du för utveckla affärer och verksamheter genom insikt och analys? Då är jobbet som analyschef på Aller media något för dig Vill du vara med och bygga upp en modern analysavdelning på ett av nordens största mediehus och vidareutveckla varumärken som Elle, Baaam och Feminina? VI ERBJUDER DIG Här erbjuds du möjligheten att driva företagets digitala resa framåt och sätta analys på kartan. Aller media är en datadriven organisation som kan erbjuda dig utrymmet att bygga något nytt från grunden. Här kommer du in i en familjär och välkomnande atmosfär där vi värdesätter samarbete framför vassa armbågar.  Varje dag skapar Aller media innehåll och tjänster för att göra Sveriges kvinnors liv rikare. DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS Din primära uppgift blir att öka analyskraften i alla delar av affären. För att kunna skapa 360-analyser, personaliserade erbjudanden och innehåll behövs en datalake byggas och en ny organisation formas. Därför söker vi dig som vill växa och utveckla snarare än förvalta.  Du kommer bland annat:  Ansvara för rekrytering och prioritera actions framåt Leda och driva arbetet mot en datalake, som i sin tur kommer ligga till grund för framtida analysarbete Skapa 360-analyser för att få en bättre förståelse och bli ännu mer relevanta för Aller medias målgrupp Vara med och sätta upp KPI:er och modeller för konvertering.  DITT TEAM OCH ARBETSPLATS Aller media arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och i det kommer du ha en central roll som innebär daglig kontakt med övriga delar av organisationen. I rollen kommer du även att samarbeta med Aller medias nordiska enheter. Kontoret är beläget vid Stureplan i centrala Stockholm.  Teamet består idag av data scientist, webanalytiker, kundinsiktsanalytiker och förväntas växa under din ledning MER OM DIG Vi föreställer oss att du tidigare haft en operativ roll inom analys och nu gått mot en mer strategisk riktning. Du har en förmåga att få med dig människor och kan med lätthet förmedla värdet av analysarbetet i relation till strategiska beslut. Vidare ser vi framför oss att du tilltalas av att driva den digitala resan utifrån ett holistiskt perspektiv. Du tänker brett och har förmågan att ta nya perspektiv och är inte rädd för att kliva in och ta initiativ, samtidigt som förändringen man ska genomföra kräver ödmjukhet och lyhördhet.  Vi hoppas och tror att du brinner för Aller medias produkter och ser tydligt framför dig hur du kan bidra till organisationens fortsatta växande. SÅ HÄR FÅR VI KONTAKT I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!  Aller media Aller media är marknadsledande inom populärpress i Sverige, med en marknadsandel på 64 %. Vi har några av Sveriges mest välkända varumärken inom tidskrifter, såsom ELLE, Må Bra, Svensk Damtidning, ELLE Decoration, Allers, Hänt TV, Baaam, Femina och Residence. Vi på Aller media formas av det vi gillar att göra allra bäst: underhålla, engagera och inspirera Sveriges kvinnor. Vi älskar att tillsammans skapa unika upplevelser och innehåll som får människors hjärtan att slå lite snabbare, något som också känns i stämningen i vårt mediehus. Här finns en inbjudande gemenskap och en omtanke om varandra som gör det så mycket roligare och så mycket mer inspirerande att testa nya idéer och utvecklas tillsammans för att fokusera på vår gemensamma framgång. Vi firar våra framsteg och hjälper varandra när det behövs. Tillsammans inspirerar och utmanar vi varandra, och jobbar intensivt på att överträffa våra kunders förväntningar.
p_a8361f23c39249a6: Just nu söker vi efter en ambitiös och nytänkande CRM Analytiker/Data Scientist. Jag heter Matthias Evelönn och leder CRM Analytics för Telia Sverige och jag har ett fantastiskt gäng med likasinnade i mitt team som alla är riktiga stjärnor inom analys och modellering. Din nästa utmaning? Som CRM Analytiker/Data Scientist kommer du att utveckla, bygga och förvalta data set för kampanj/aktivitet - och modellexekvering främst mot våra företagskunder. Vidare ingår det i rollen att verka som expertstöd och levera insight till våra affärsområden (främst Small business) . Du kommer också vara en nyckelspelare i uppföljning av våra aktiviteter och genomför en viss del av selektering och uttag av målgrupper. Du drar slutsatser och kommer med rekommendationer för att kontinuerligt öka effektiviteten i våra marknadsaktiviteter i tät dialog med affärsintressenter. Viktigt för att lyckas i den här rollen är att du har en mycket god matematisk och analytisk förmåga och ett genuint intresse för företagsaffären. Du kan se helheter och dra relevanta slutsatser och levererar detta på ett förståeligt och användarvänligt sätt. Som person är du strukturerad och arbetar lätt med andra människor. Du kommer att ansluta till ett gäng på 4 personer som har tydligt kundfokus och passion för analys samt datadriven marknadsföring. Vi har en härlig laganda och du blir omgiven av vänner som verkligen vill hjälpa dig att lyckas. Det är du som driver analys för våra största kunder så du måste kunna jobba självständigt men du har givetvis alltid stöd från övriga kollegor när hjälp så behövs. Och vem är du? Naturligtvis har du en relevant utbildning och erfarenhet av kodning. Du har jobbat med stora datamängder och är van att vända och vrida på data. Men framför allt brinner du för att implementera ett datadrivet arbetssätt i hela organisationen. Dina intressenter är allt från personer som inte är så mogna för analys till erfarna analytiker så det krävs att du kan framföra dina analyser på ett pedagogiskt vis till den aktuella målgruppen. Du förväntas kunna kommunicera på både svenska och engelska. Din personlighet: Analytisk Affärsdriven och proaktiv Nyfiken Kundfokuserad ”Doer” mentalitet Lagspelare Din erfarenhet: Minst 2 års erfarenhet av avancerad matematisk kund- och marknadsanalys samt användandet av tekniker, verktyg och metoder inom området Bakgrund inom telekom och mobila tjänster är ett plus Bra kommunikationsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska Relevant utbildning gärna inom statistik/matematik SQL, Python eller R Erfarenhet av SAS och QlikSense är meriterande Intresserad? Vill du bli en del av vårt gäng, sök jobbet. Vill du veta mer, ring mig på +46 72 527 12 12 eller kontakta mig på LinkedIn. Rekryteringen sker löpande, så tveka inte att höra av dig. Senaste ansökningsdag är 28 mars 2019. Välkommen till Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!
p_60f511c8750578d4: CEO Office is now looking to hire two Data Analysts. Within the prioritized area of AML Swedbank is now further strengthening the analytical capabilities by forming a new AML Analytical team. As a Data Analyst we expect you to be an expert in the field of advanced analytics with the right skills to deliver high qualitative modelling. We use state-of-the art infrastructure for data sourcing, as well as a variety of analytics tools available. About the job As a Data Analyst you will play a key role in reaching our vision of ensuring that Swedbank has an updated and functioning AML monitoring solution that meets regulatory requirements and support Group Security Investigation to be efficient in their work to detect suspicious money-laundering and terrorist financing cases. As a Data Analyst your responsibility will be to deliver advanced data analytics to leverage of the big amount of data by performing data discovery, modelling and using a variety of modern algorithms including for example random forests and deep learning methods. You are passionate in delivering value for the business by providing results that can be used for development and optimization of new and existing AML detection methods and development of functionality in order to support AML investigators in decision making and reduce manual work. You will be part of a new cross functional team that will consist of Data Analysts, Risk translators, Software Engineers and Agile Product Owner/Team Manager. We work with the Swedbank common Data Lake, Data Discovery Platform and programming languages as Python, R and Scala used for analytics and modelling. We also use an 3rd party AML solution for which we are responsible for development and optimization of AML monitoring scenarios. What you need to succeed You are a solution-orientated Data Analyst with excellent analytical and problem solving skills. You are flexible and responsive and quality and service-minded. You aim to do things purposefully and structurally. You are used to work with a customer-centric mind-set and you know how to suggest and implement the outcome from advanced data analytics that leads to business value. You are a strong team-player. The following skills will be beneficial: Statistical modeling Machine learning Supervised learning: decision trees, random forests, logistic regression Unsupervised learning: clustering, dimensionality reduction Program and scripting languages (Phyton, R, Scala) Databases SQL and NoSQL Data lakes and related technologies (Hadoop, Spark) Story telling skills  What you may have worked with previously You have a university degree in mathematics, physics or computer science. You have practical experience working as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist with advanced analytics. Previous experience from working in the financial industry is not necessary. Potential next steps in your career after this job Many other interesting roles at Swedbank. Why work with us? We as a team consider us to work in one of the most interesting and dynamic areas with an interesting combination of Data Analytics, IT-development and Business Knowledge. The team is characterized by its good cooperation both within the team and towards other units. We strive to achieve a good work/life balance and we are always open to new ideas and thoughts helping us improving as a team.  We may begin the selection under the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible. Nothing of interest for you – recommend the job to a friend! We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.
p_5253b7c55f429901: Institutionen för medicinsk epidemiologi och biostatistik (MEB) är bland de största institutionerna inom epidemiologi i Europa och har ett särskilt fokus på att fördjupa vår kunskap om olika sjukdomars orsak. Vår institution består av forskare, doktorander, biostatistiker, datainsamlare, databasadministratörer och administrativ personal, totalt cirka 250 anställda. Institutionen är belägen på campusområdet i Solna. Mer information finns på: ki.se/meb Division- KI Psychiatric Genomics Institute (KI-PGI) We seek a new postdoc who will work in the KI-PGI, led by Prof Patrick Sullivan. The KI-PGI is a research program within MEB with 10 year funding from the Swedish Research Council. The KI-PGI begins with fundamental genomic findings and then elucidates the implications for patients, clinicians, and neuroscientists. We are deeply collaborative, and we actively work with at least 10 major genetic, psychiatric, neuroscience, and functional genomic groups. We have established, long term collaborations within the KI, Sweden, Europe, the US, and Australia. We have multiple large new datasets. These recent papers describe our efforts in psychiatric genomics, functional genomics, identification of brain cell types for schizophrenia (initial study and replication), the work of the PGC, and reviews for the field (Cell, 2019, in press). These are only a subset of efforts now underway. The overarching goals of the KI-PGI are: on a population scale, how do genes and environment act and interact to modify risk for severe psychiatric disorders? By what molecular and cellular mechanisms do these genes act? We have data from large case-control studies of schizophrenia, and all subjects have been comprehensively evaluated with genome-wide SNP arrays, CNVs, and whole exome and whole genome sequencing. Larger studies are in progress including expansion of the Swedish Schizophrenia Study (S3), Genomic Aggregation Project in Sweden (GAPS), and TRYGGVE2 (an effort to harmonize psychiatric genomics in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden). Prof Sullivan has a track record of postdoc advancement. Two recent KI postdocs now have their own labs and, in the past 15 years, more than 10 postdocs have advanced to Assistant or Associate Professor with independent funding. Duties We seek an outstanding and innovative postdoc to join our team. We are data-rich, and need a professional-level data scientist to maximize our understanding of the data we have collected and to identify new data that we need to make. This individual should be passionately committed to furthering knowledge of severe psychiatric disorders in order to improve the lives of people. The successful applicant will join the KI-PGI team and conduct research on the genomics and functional genomics of severe psychiatric disorders leveraging “multi-omic” approaches and/or ML-approaches to high-dimensional and complex register data. Entry requirements KI Postdoctoral Researchers must have obtained a PhD within the past 3 years (extension might be granted for sickness, parental leave, clinical work, union work or similar circumstances). Applicants should have a PhD in computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, biostatistics, or genetics. We will consider those with PhDs in other areas but who have advanced/relevant data science skills (e.g., machine learning). Applicants should have substantial prior experience in professional analysis of multiple types of modern genomic and functional genomic datasets. These might include: GWAS, exome sequencing, whole genome sequencing, RNA-sequencing. Modern genomics requires advanced skills in programming (e.g., R, python, SAS), use of standard software packages (e.g., PLINK, GATK), flexibly manipulating large datasets, bioinformatic integration, and pathway analysis. Knowledge of complex trait genomics is very important. Knowledge of psychiatric genomics (particularly schizophrenia or major depression) is helpful but can be taught if required. Applicants should be highly collegial and experienced in working effectively in “team science” contexts. Successful Sullivan postdocs possess exceptional organizational skills and know how to multitask. Applicants will be asked to describe past examples of having developed structured approaches to solving unanticipated and complex problems. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English are required, along with ample experience with scientific writing.  Application process An employment application must contain the following documents in English or Swedish: A complete curriculum vitae, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work A complete list of publications A summary of current work (no more than one page) The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet med visionen att på ett avgörande sätt bidra till att förbättra människors hälsa. I Sverige står Karolinska Institutet för den enskilt största andelen medicinsk akademisk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar. Varje år utser Nobelförsamlingen vid Karolinska Institutet mottagare av Nobelpriset i fysiologi eller medicin.  Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter arkiveras ansökningshandlingar i två år efter att tillsättningsbeslutet vunnit laga kraft. Detta gäller dock ej bilagor som är tryckta eller på annat sätt publicerade.  Karolinska Institutet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats med jämn könsfördelning som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.  Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
p_a8e1d47b78889e66: About the role The Mitigram Analytics team provides leadership and vision for developing and implementing data analytics and modelling strategies into the Mitigram marketplace. It provides data-driven insights to support internal business strategy and decision making both to Mitigram and its clients. Working in close collaboration with our Data Scientist, you will apply your understanding of complex data analysis and modelling to help Mitigram and its clients extract value from the Mitigram marketplace data. This data will enable Mitigram and its clients to take strategic business decisions that will support increased performance and competitivity.  You will: Develop solutions that are driven by exploratory data analysis Apply your knowledge of statistics, programming, data modeling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions and make valuable discoveries that lead to better business decision-making Perform data analysis tests in line with agreed strategies Communicate analysis results and recommendations to team member Provide input on data visualization techniques and opportunities About you You love numbers and data. You have an ability to see the big picture in a complex pattern. You are technically skilled at data analysis and your skillset and experience include: Power BI and SQL Data mining, analysis and modelling of complex data sets Knowledge of statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing (A/B testing) and optimization algorithms You enjoy working in a flexible, informal and young environment where everyone works hard but does not forget to have fun and be friendly to each other Ideally, but not necessarily, you have a Bachelor or Master’s degree About Mitigram Mitigram is a fast growing Swedish company based in Stockholm, with the ambition to transform the trade finance industry. p_344ed7953e0b8b66: Your Responsibilities:  Are you the Medical Affairs Scientist ready to support the delivery of medical excellence in strategic medical planning for the Benelux-Nordics Area? Includes, but not limited toSupporting appropriate use of all GSK products and fulfil designated tasks of Consumer Health Safety Point of Contact where assignedPartner with SPoC and local Pharmacovigilance team in order to ensure that GSK activities are conducted in accordance with applicable Regulations and Company policiesResponsible for medical activities including but not restricted to:  o Development and medical approval of accurate, scientifically supported and business relevant claims  o Support to market information / global insights on data collection and analysis of GSK products and competitors Support GSK Medical Governance Framework LI-GSK  Why You?   • Degree in Biomedical Science, Pharmacist or Medical Doctor Medical Affairs industry experience (at least 3 years) operating in a commercial environment, preferably in the Pharma, OTC and/or Nutritional spaceMinimum 4 years of strong, multi-discipline experience including clinical development, operations, project management or other functions in order to act decisively to manage the operational needs of the Global Medical Community with minor direction.Demonstrated business acumenDemonstrated project management and organizational skills. Ability to facilitate alignment and collaboration across groups/regions.Fluent in Swedish and English  Preferred qualifications:  Master’s degree, PhD or similar  Why GSK?:  A science-led global healthcare company with a special purpose: to help people do more, feel better, live longer. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.  Contact information:  You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button. Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies  GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. p_c498bb645787cabf: Do you have an experimental approach to solving problems and equipped with a curious mindset? How about the combination of data, coding and creating AI/ML tools to help our teams enhance our players experiences? Then you must be our new, shiny, AI Engineer! Your role within our Kingdom You´ll be part of a team of 14 Kingsters (with roles as Product Owner, AI Engineers, Developers and Data Scientists) working closely together on multiple products. Our mission? Create products for advanced analytics of game performance to self-generation of game content, and anything in-between! As an AI Engineer at King, you will be developing, implementing and advancing our games and business applications to the next level by using the latest in the field of Machine Learning (ML) and AI. Including Deep Neural Networks for supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning as well as more traditional ML methods. With over 260+ million monthly active users and 47 billion events being uploaded daily, you´ll really have a lot to dig in to and together with collaborative team members you´ll get to learn on the job every day! Skills to create thrills So what about you? You probably started off as engineer/developer and during your career have been working with analytical/data products. Or maybe you started off on the analytical side, digging into data, in a role within business intelligence or data science. Then your curiosity took over and you wanted to solve problems through automation and as a result, you started to get wildly interested in AI/ML solutions, experimenting with data and algorithms. More importantly, you´ve learned along the way that collaboration and experimenting is key to find new solutions. Degree in computer science, mathematics, machine learning or equivalent Solid working knowledge of Python Working experience of Tensorflow or similar frameworks Experience with or genuine interest in AI/ML applications Tasty bonus skills Have any sweet experience with one or some of the following areas? Then we sure like to hear about them! Development in or exposure to environments/sw products in C++ and/or Java Game development and/or game engines Mobile products (iOS/Android development) Contributions to open source projects We know that you are in to games on some level (casual, console, board-games, Uno etc.) and if you also have experience working in the online gaming industry, we´d sure like to hear your story! A great saga needs all sorts of heroes Making games is fun! Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it. We’re Seriously Playful We believe that great gaming experiences happen when they are developed by working in small, autonomous creative teams that control the whole process - from idea to amazing products. Our close connection with the player community gets us instant feedback and enables us to deliver truly magical moments. We value your free time and your need to refuel, relax and find inspiration - by playing games with your colleagues, being at home with your family or going to the gym or out for a run. That's how we stay creative! Ready to level up? Join our Kingdom! You’ll find all you need to apply (and it´s super-easy!), plus more information on our culture, values and benefits, including relocation packages at jobs.king.com. All applications should be made in English and we´re keen on getting to know you and the stuff that makes you tick! p_22f2944674452a33: Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. p_c3af7c54646e69f8: 10x Genomics ( http://www.10xgenomics.com/ ) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry and bioinformatics, our award-winning Chromium™ System is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the fundamentals of biology at unprecedented resolution and scale. Learn more at 10xGenomics.com ( http://www.10xGenomics.com ).  #GOEXPONENTIAL  Fueled by equal parts scientific vision and determined passion, we are delivering unprecedented innovation to short-read sequencing technologies and transforming how genomic information is accessed. You will feel the 10x difference the moment you enter our offices and labs. There's a dynamic energy here, and we're looking for the best of the best to be a part of it. We are seeking talented professionals excited to build new technology that advances scientific research while growing their career within a dynamic, supportive environment.  Location: Stockholm, Sweden  Molecular Biology Scientist - Stockholm, Sweden  We are looking for an exceptional scientist to drive new research and product development efforts at our Stockholm R&D facility, with an emphasis on spatial transcriptomics. The ideal candidate will have a proven track-record of developing creative and novel molecular biology protocols for solving complex biological problems, as well as a broad understanding of next generation sequencing and its applications. He/she should be driven by making great products and enjoy working in a truly multi-disciplinary environment. This position will part of our Molecular Biology department and interact closely with colleagues across R&D departments in both Stockholm and Pleasanton, CA. Job level and title will be commensurate with experience.  Key Responsibilities   Conceive and develop novel molecular biology assay schemes for use of 10x Genomics technology platforms, with emphasis on spatial transcriptomics. Plan and perform systematic workflow and reagent optimization by modeling, identification of limiting steps and use of formal design of experiment (DOE) approaches. Contribute molecular biology expertise and leadership to cross-disciplinary product development teams. Work closely with computational biologists to interpret data generated by novel and optimized assay schemes. Work closely with process development staff to develop quality control and manufacturing strategies for novel or optimized reagents.  Required Skills and Background   PhD in molecular biology, biochemistry, or a similar field with a minimum of 3 years post-graduate experience in academia and/or industry. Proven ability to design novel molecular biology assay schemes, as evidenced by peer-reviewed publications, published patents or launched products. Strong organizational skills. Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication. Ability to work in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment A strong desire to build game-changing technologies and impact the world of life science research  Desired Skills and Background   Experience in spatial transcriptomics, in situ RNA or protein assays or other technologies for analysis of complex tissues. Experience in single-cell genomics, functional genomics or immunology. Experience developing high-throughput assays based on next generation sequencing. Experience in computational analysis of next-generation sequencing data.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
p_f9594c3dd872fc2d: Come work at the Good Times Factory! At MAG we have a firm belief that the key to producing great games is teamwork and trust. We trust everyone in the company with the freedom to decide what team they want to work with and how they can most effectively contribute. In turn, each team owns its respective game and decides on how best to proceed in development. This way, everyone at MAG feels valued and has the opportunity to work on the projects that they love within a positive environment. In order to drive innovation within the company, we have monthly hackathons during which everyone in the company comes together to learn new things, work on side projects, develop game concepts, and/or build prototypes for new games. We believe that happy people with the freedom to flex their creativity make great entertainment, and this is how we nicknamed ourselves The Good Times Factory. Making great games should be fun, and we encourage that! The Job: As a part of the AI team you will play a crucial part of building MAGs implementation of Machine Learning. You will work on a variety of problems such as personalisation, targeting, optimization etc. You will come up with new and interesting hypotheses, test them, and scale them up to massive data sets, so that your algorithms and models can be used to improve critical components for all our games. Responsibilities: Leverage your experience to drive best practices in ML and data science projects Develop workflows and processes for data science, in particular machine learning, projects Develop predictive and prescriptive models to personalize our player experience and support our marketing efforts Implement ML models into live games Required skills: 3+ years of relevant work experience developing, evaluating, deploying and maintaining ML models You have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems Experience with Python, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow and Keras You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation

p_bf54d0c4f906b38b: Kan du få siffror och diagram att berätta en historia? Trivs du i en roll där du direkt ser påverkan och resultat av ditt arbete? Just nu finns chansen för dig som har ett starkt intresse för teknik och hur IT kan användas direkt i affären att söka tjänsten som Data Scientist. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en spännande organisation med starkt varumärke. Du erbjuds en verksamhetsnära roll där du formar fina egna framgångar och får bidra med utveckling och förbättring av processer. Om tjänsten Inom Axfood agerar Dagab Inköp & Logistik AB, som är en gemensam organisation för inköp, lager och transport till Willys, Hemköp och Axfoods övriga butikskedjor, där även e-handeln tar en stor del av bland annat förvärvade Mat.se. Dagab Inköp & Logistik är en del av Axfood AB som är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm AB:s Large Cap-lista. Som medarbetare på Dagab blir du en del av en företagskultur som kännetecknas av stort engagemang och gott kamratskap.  Som Data Scientist kommer du tillhöra en centraliserad funktion inom controlling som agerar tvärfunktionellt för att skapa förutsättningar för affärsutveckling och lönsamhet. Du kommer tillhöra ett team om fyra personer. Teamets uppgift är att stötta hela verksamheten och hantera data för att fördjupa företagets insikter från affären, med syfte att skapa rätt förutsättningar för företaget att ta datadriva beslut. Det innebär tekniskt och analytiskt arbete för att skapa beslutsstöd och underlag för effektivisering.  Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Academic Work men du kommer anställas direkt hos Axfood. Alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work.  Arbetsuppgifter Du kommer till exempel att:  Bygga scorecards och rapporter för att skapa beslutsstöd och underlag för effektivisering  Analys av försäljning, bruttovinst, utfall och påverkan från kampanjer  Utforska och visualisera strukturerad och ostrukturerad data  Bygger modeller, skapar kluster, mikrosegment och levererar analys som påverkar slutkonsument  Tjänsten passar dig som motiveras av att driva ditt eget arbete och arbeta med förbättringar. Vidare får du en möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får påverka ditt arbete i en stor utsträckning. För rätt person finns det möjlighet att ta sig an fler ansvarsområden.  Vi söker dig som För att kunna nyttja dessa möjligheter behöver du ha en del kunskap och erfarenhet med dig din första dag medan resten kan du lära dig. Men du behöver:  Vara flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift med hänsyn till de kontaktytor du kommer att ha i rollen  Inneha en utbildning som civilingenjör inom matematik/statistik/finans, alternativt har fått motsvarande kunskaper anskaffad genom arbetslivserfarenhet  Ha grundläggande kunskaper inom SQL  Ha grundläggande kunskaper inom Excel  Det är ett stort plus om du:  Haft en verksamhetsnära roll inom IT och/eller ekonomi  Har erfarenhet av FMCG  Rollen som Data Scientist kräver att du har en god problemlösningsförmåga där du oavsett utmaning du ställs inför genomför dina arbetsuppgifter med god kvalité. Du är analytisk, älskar siffror och har ett systematiskt arbetssätt. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och tar gärna hjälp, samt hjälper dina kollegor för att tillsammans få ett bra resultat.  Övrig information Start: Omgående, enligt överenskommelse  Omfattning: Heltid, inledande provanställning om 6 månader  Lön: Fast lön  Placering: Torsplan, Stockholm  Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på Ansök nedan, vi tar inte emot ansökningar på mailen. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen. Vi ser gärna att din ansökan är på engelska.  Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Axfoods önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Nina Ha, Rekryteringskoordinator.  Om oss Academic Work är Home of the young professionals. Det betyder att de flesta av våra jobb är relevanta för dig som studerar på högskola/universitet eller för dig som är klar med dina studier och är i början av din karriär. Hos oss kan du arbeta som konsult på uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, bli anställd direkt hos ett kundföretag via vår rekryteringsverksamhet eller börja jobba internt på något av våra Academic Work kontor. Läs mer på www.academicwork.se.  Information om företaget Dagab ansvarar för att Axfoods sortiment, inköp och logistik ska fungera optimalt. Som supportbolag har Dagab en nyckelroll i Axfoods arbete med att ständigt effektivisera varuflödet från sortiment och inköp till lagerhantering och distribution.  Läs gärna mer om Axfood på deras hemsida.  Ansök här

p_04f1cb018e7e2bcd: At Epidemic Sound we are reinventing the music industry. Our carefully curated music library, with over 30,000 tracks, is tailored for storytellers no matter what their story is. Epidemic Sound’s music is heard in hundreds of thousands of videos on online video platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitch and Instagram. Our HQ is located in Stockholm with offices in NYC, LA, Hamburg, Amsterdam and Madrid. We are growing fast, we have lots of fun and we are transforming the music industry. We are now looking for a Data Scientist. Actually. You can call yourself Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Guru, Analytics Enthusiast or Easter Bunny if you like, the thing is: we have data and you are good at data.  Job Description To take our analytics capabilities to the next level, help build our data and business intelligence department, influence the company through data driven insights and change the music industry worldwide we are looking for a highly talented and versatile Data Scientist to focus on our marketing initiatives. You should be skilled in data analysis, visualization, communication and parsing commercial opportunities from vast amounts of data using SQL, R, pencils, recycled paper, whiteboards, speakers turned up a little too loud and coffee. One of your core objectives will be to help our teams better understand their data and apply it in their daily work and decision making by: Proactively developing cutting edge analyses and insights to drive decisions and strategies for music intake, user acquisition, retention, monetization and after-work optimization Providing reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources Visualizing and communicating KPIs across the whole group and directly to management What are we looking for? You are a fast learner with a collaborative disposition and have the ability to draw business insights to add real value to the business. You should have recent experience in dealing with large, real-world datasets from a digital, data driven environment, a degree in a quantitative field from a leading university and, foremost, a drive to make an impact. Other skills we think you have: Fluency in Python or R for data analysis Excellent understanding of SQL AWS and/or Google Cloud Google Analytics Ability to demonstrate hands on experience with data mining, clustering, segmentation and machine learning Fluency in English Merit to those with significant exposure to online marketing and/or e-commerce Application Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply by clicking the link below. Any questions should be addressed to bi@epidemicsound.com.
